editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.
Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.standard: With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: This spectacular collection by Zen Studios, the Jedi masters of virtual pinball, brings the Star Wars saga to life like youâ€™ve never seen it before. Based on the films, TV shows, and even iconic characters, each dazzlingly detailed game plays like a true labor of love. Beyond the brilliant table designs, the flawless physics faithfully recreate the mechanics of real pinball with stunning sights and sounds straight out of a galaxy far, far away.

name: Willy's Wonderland
artistName: QUByte Games Desenvolvimento de Jogos LTDA

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

Our beloved Om Nom is on another quest for candy, and not even the supernatural will get in the way of his sweet tooth. Featuring a totally revamped (and gorgeous) visual style and tons of new gameplay elements, Cut the Rope: Magic totally transforms the seriesâ€”as well as our hungry hero. For the first time ever, Om Nom can morph into all sorts of creaturesâ€”from a bird to a baby to a mouseâ€”to solve each enchanting puzzle.

editorialNotes.standard: Use curious elevators to cross beautiful buildings in a puzzler thatâ€™s as stylish as it is confounding.

With Free App of the Week, we highlight a great app you can enjoy at no charge this week. (In-App Purchases sold separately.) ZeptoLabâ€™s highly anticipated sequel is an absolute blast, filled with endless charm and brilliantly designed physics-based puzzles. Use all-new allies and abilities to feed the adorable Om Nom candy while navigating each stageâ€™s unique layout and collecting stars along the way. With new mechanics smartly layered onto the seriesâ€™ already famous gameplay, Cut the Rope 2 is continually challenging and engaging.

editorialNotes.standard: Juggle impatient passengers by efficiently moving elevators in this minimalist mix of puzzling and strategy.

Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalancheâ€”the pressureâ€™s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the gameâ€™s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

One of the App Storeâ€™s early sensations, Doodle Jump HD has only improved with age. The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.
